result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather M Thayer

records.addlTxt:
11:06 AM Defendant Heather M Thayer appeared by phone.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Heather M Thayer.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CF90-PH, 22CM63-RH and 22CM64-RH.  Court calls the cases.  Per Atty Krave, DE will waive PH. Court instructs on waiver of PH. Court will accept waiver of PH, DE makes waiver knowingly, freely and voluntarily, court will accept waiver of PH.  Set 22CF90 for Arraignment, and CM cases for Status.  Adj 11:12am.
Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.

1:51 PM Defendant Heather M Thayer in court.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Heather M Thayer.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 2CF90, 22CM63, 22CM64.  Init app in all cases.  

22CF90-Waive reading of the CC.  DE/Atty will waive the time limits for PH.  Court instructs. 
22CM63-22CM64-Waive reading of the CC, enter a plea of NG.

State asks for a $2500.00 sign bond, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. All concurrent bonds. 

Set for September 12, 2022 @ 11:00AM.  Adj 2:05PM.
